basics.name: Winston Wei-Han Chou
basics.label: Undergraduate Student
basics.summary: Aspiring applied Scientist and Roboticist focus on Engineering, Physics, and Management Studies. Currently studying at the University of California, San Diego. Passionate about advancing research in robotics, artificial intelligence, and applied sciences. Committed to promoting STEM education through various outreach programs and initiatives.

education.area: BS in Mechanical & Aerospace Engineering, Specialized in Controls & Robotics | GPA: 3.99/4.0
courses: Robotics: Introduction to Autonomous Vehicles, Robotics (Graduate), Sensing and Estimation in Robotics (Graduate), Machine Learning for Robotics (Graduate)
AI/ML: Machine Learning for Robotics (Graduate), Probability and Statistical Methods for Engineering, Computational Methods in Engineering
Mechanical: Design of Machine Elements, Computational Methods for Design, Solid Mechanics I, Mechanical Behavior of Materials

skills.name: Software & Embedded
keywords: Python, C++, C, LabVIEW, MATLAB, Java, HTML
ROS, ROS2 (Robot Operating System), Git, Docker, Keras, Tensorflow

experience.organization: UC San Diego, ECE & MAE Department
experience.position: Teaching Assistant, ECEMAE 148 Introduction to Autonomous Vehicles
experience.summary: Support student learning in robotics system integration, computer vision, navigation algorithms, computational strategies, machine learning systems, and vehicle dynamics.
highlights: Guide students in robotics system integration, computer vision, navigation algorithms, and machine learning.
Coach on programming assignments and project development.
Hold weekly office hours to support student learning.

experience.summary: Contributed to advancing the TAI-namics Software Stack with a primary focus on progressing from Model-in-Loop (MIL) testing toward Hardware-in-Loop (HIL) implementation.
highlights: Optimized spacecraft simulation software performance by 98% through MATLAB-C++ interface redesign.
Developed Coefficient Proxy system for seamless data extraction and configuration management.
Migrated 5 critical spacecraft models to MATLAB with validation testing for TAI-namics software stack.
Researched and modeled 3D propellant sloshing dynamics using SE(3) screw theory and Lagrangian mechanics, achieving superior accuracy compared to linear models w.r.t. CFD validation.

experience.summary: Developed features for the Autonomous Mobile Robot (AMR) product line and improved odometry accuracy through sensor integration and control algorithm implementation.
highlights: Integrated AMR position and velocity data into ROS, enabling remote PID tuning.
Designed encoder accuracy experiments, identified and reduced wheel sensor errors, and improved odometry by 0.49%.
Implemented Ramsete Controller to support odometry testing and planner development.

experience.summary: Contribute to the Indy Autonomous Challenge, focusing on autonomous vehicle simulation and performance optimization using dSPACE systems.
highlights: Develop and manage simulation interfaces for real-time testing of autonomous driving algorithms.
Integrate MATLAB/Simulink models with dSPACE hardware-in-the-loop (HIL) simulators.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize simulation workflows.

experience.position: GoKart Software Team Lead / F1TENTH Racer Team Lead
experience.summary: Lead software development and autonomous racing for full-scale electric go-kart and F1TENTH teams, participating in international competitions.
highlights: Managed a team of 20+ engineers developing sensor fusion, trajectory planning, and motion control algorithms.
Oversaw participation in the Autonomous Karting Series and F1TENTH Autonomous Grand Prix.
Led teams in competitions organized by IEEE IV, ICRA, and IROS.

volunteer.summary: Mentor for FIRST Robotics Competition team, guiding students in advanced control theory, robot design, and competition strategy.
highlights: Mentored 40+ students in robotics system development, control algorithms, and fabrication techniques.
Guided implementation of Kalman filter algorithms and FEA-based design verification.
Introduced advanced failure prediction and design methodologies for competition robots.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
highlights: Quantum Teleportation
Quantum Cryptography

awards.title: CKHSAASC Golden Brick Leadership Scholarship Award
awards.awarder: Chien Kuo High School Alumni Association of Southern California
awards.summary: Recognize the outstanding achievements of Chien Kuo High School Alumni Association of Southern California (CKHSAASC) student members or the descendants of CKHSAASC members as defined by CKHSAASC Bylaws.

awards.title: CCBA Southern California Outstanding Youth Achievement Award
awards.summary: The Chinese Consolidated Benevolent Association of Southern California's Outstanding Youth Achievement Awards and Model Youth Conference is an annual event hosted by the Chinese Consolidated Benevolent Association (CCBA) of Southern California. It aims to recognize the outstanding achievements of young Chinese Americans and encourage them to actively participate in society and demonstrate leadership. The awards cover a variety of areas, including academic performance, community service, arts and culture, athletics, and innovation, aiming to identify and recognize outstanding young people who have demonstrated outstanding professional and societal contributions.

awards.title: CKHSAASC Golden Brick Leadership Scholarship Award
awards.awarder: Chien Kuo High School Alumni Association of Southern California
awards.summary: Recognize the outstanding achievements of Chien Kuo High School Alumni Association of Southern California (CKHSAASC) student members or the descendants of CKHSAASC members as defined by CKHSAASC Bylaws.

awards.title: Distinguished Service Award
awards.awarder: Taipei Municipal Chien Kuo High School
awards.summary: Serve as Class leader for three consecutive years (10th, 11th, and 12th grades) and actively participate in various school activities, demonstrating leadership and commitment to the school community.

awards.title: Outstanding Performance Mayor Award
awards.summary: Category II Mayor Award (Outstanding Performance Mayor Award): Graduates who have outstanding performance during their studies, such as in sports, skills, arts, science or creativity, club activities, community or school service learning, respect for teachers and parents, acts of helping others, and other specific achievements.
